classroom: 講義実験棟１０１ , 講義実験棟１０２
overview: This course is a practical introduction to the language you will need if you get a job as an engineer and will be required to use English at work. It presents English from a wide variety of engineering fields and situations, develops communication skills, covers essential grammar, and provides background in major engineering concepts.
objectives: The aim in this course is to aid the development of professional skills based on practical learning. Students will improve their speaking, listening and reading skills, and gain confidence in presenting ideas in English. While improving their speaking, listening and reading skills, students will be able to communicate in work situations with both foreign and domestic engineers, and will be able to present their ideas in English. [International Education, Professional skills based on practical learning, Communication Skills]
teachingMethod: Students will engage in a wide range of engineering-related speaking, listening and reading activities, and practice giving explanations of processes to fellow students. The classes will be conducted in English, and students are expected to use only English in class.
notes: Students should have passed the four compulsory first-year English courses: English SL I and II, and English RW I and II.
preparation: Students will be asked to preview the vocabulary for the following unit, and review expressions and structures covered in the current lesson.  There will be regular homework.
textbook: Bonamy, David; Technical English 1 (second edition ) Pearson; ISBN 978-1-292-42446-0
